View Cell Availability

Use this task to check the availability of cells a after configuring service for GSM (2G) and LTE (4G) vNodes to which they are associated.

  1. In the navigation bar, click Devices > Cell Availability.
  2. In the window a list of LTE (4G) cells that are active display by default in the LTE tab. The following table describles the fields that display information for (both GSM and LTE) cells:

    Column

    Description
    TimeStamp Displays the most current timestamp for cell activity.
    EndTimeStamp Displays the end timestamp for a cell.
    CellId Specific Identifier of a physical cell.
    EnbId eNodeB identifier (ID)
    vNode Name

    The vNode name, which is a combination the previous device ID, product class and serial number entries that were made.

    For example: 41733-C19999- S3837C2X1113972
    vNodeId Displays the vNode ID and serial number.
    Cell Name User-assigned name for the 2G or 4G cell.
    Cell Type Identifies whether the cell is LTE or GSM.
    TotalDuration The total amount of time that this cell has been active in hours.
    AvailableTime The amount of time that this cell has been available in hours.
    Availability % The total percentage of time that this cell has been available.
    The following window shows an example of LTE cells that are available through devices managed by the PW EMS:
